title: NSW Design System
description: The NSW Digital Design System is a toolkit to help digital product teams create good customer experiences quickly.

title: What is Design System
description:
The NSW Design System is a single source of truth for the design and development of digital products and services in NSW Government. Our mission is to help teams build products and services that meet user needs and deliver great user experiences.
Embracing a code first approach, all parts of the design system have been built in alignment to deliver simple and consistent solutions.
Building from a single, best practice base ensures consistency with how our users engage and interact with NSW Government digitally. Resulting in easy to use products and services.

title: Supporting different roles
description:
The NSW Design System can be used by any department and brand classification, to provide a consistent approach to UI and UX for designers and developers. Even if you're not using the component kits, our ecosystem allows teams to identify and use only what they require.
While the out-of-the-box branding reflects masterbrand corporate, the in-built theming framework can be adapted for all masterbrand, co-brand and even independent classification levels. Endorsed and stand-alone brand classifications can also take advantage of the pre-built base, easily adapted to their own brand identity.

title: Our ecosystem
description: The NSW Design System ecosystem is build to be reusable and adaptable for different applications. Depending on your requirements, you can use only what you need. This may be all elements when building from scratch or just the core when updating existing products to new requirements.

title: What/'s happening
description: Releases, Work in progress, Consulting with community, Backlog

title: Getting Started
description: Use the NSW Design System to create customer-centred digital products and services that meet branding and WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility guidelines. It also helps you meet the Design Standards to design for user needs

title: Figma UI Kit
description: The Figma UI Kit should not be used in isolation. Our core styles and components go beyond just look-and-feel. To produce quality user experiences, read the documentation and understand the usage and behaviour of each style and component.

title: Extending
description: To design for your specific user need, use the core elements of the NSW Design System to create consistent services for users and save your team time and effort by building with already tested and accessible solutions.

title: Theming
description: The Design System has a built-in framework for how colours are used and inherited to ensure a consistent and accessible user experience. The following guidance walks through how each branding classification can apply colour to its digital products and services using the Design System.

title: Guides
description: Using the design system, Designing, Collaborating, Prototyping

title: Getting Started
description: How you use the NSW Design System depends on your team's capabilities. We recommend using npm but also provided in a CDN, and a downloadable starter kit which includes all the compiled assets.

title: Theming
description: NSW Design System supports multiple levels of customisation based on your branding requirements.

title: Utility Classes
description: Single-responsibility classes for re-use and customisation

title: Logo
description: The visual representation of NSW Government.

title: Colour
description: Colour plays an important role in creating a consistent and strong visual identify for NSW Government digital products and services.

title: Typography
description: Documentation and examples for typography, including font, headings, body text, lists, and more.

title: Iconography
description: Icons illustrate actions, communicate status, indicate an interaction and draw attention to important information.

title: Pictograms
description: Pictograms represent a word or idea using simple and clean illustration.

title: Layout
description: Layouts are common page composition patterns that offer ways of structuring components and content.

title: Section
description: Flexible layout component that groups content and components together providing consistent vertical spacing.

title: Spacing
description: A defined set of spacing units provides good alignment and consistent spacing relationships in components and layout.

title: Graphic elements
description: Give your product a distinctly NSW look and feel

title: Accordion
description: An accordion is a series of expandable vertical panels, designed to save space on a page by hiding content and revealing it as required.

title: Breadcrumbs
description: Breadcrumbs help users to understand where they are within a websiteâ€™s structure.

title: Buttons
description: Buttons provide users with the ability to submit an action.

title: Callout
description: Callouts are a snippet of information that draws attention to important content.

title: Cards
description: Cards group related content or tasks to make it easier for users to scan, read, and find information.

title: Content blocks
description: Content blocks allow users to select from multiple actions related to a topic or task.

title: Filters
description: Filters allows a user to narrow down results using multiple attributes.

title: Footer
description: The footer displays across the bottom of all NSW Government websites.

title: Forms
description: Forms are used to capture data from users.

title: Global alert
description: Global alerts display across the top of an entire site to show important information to users.

title: Header
description: The NSW Government header displays across the top of all NSW Government sites. It helps users see which service they are using.

title: Hero banner
description: The hero banner introduces the goals or purpose of the product or service.

title: Hero search
description: Hero search provides the user with easy access to targeted search.

title: In-page alert
description: In-page alerts are used to contextually inform users of important information or status of an interaction.

title: In-page navigation
description: In-page navigation helps users scan and navigate to content on the page quickly.

title: Link list
description: Link lists surface and group related content.

title: List items
description: Display a list of results to users surfacing key information.

title: Masthead
description: The NSW Government network masthead displays across the top of all NSW Government sites. It helps users see which service they are using.

title: Media
description: Media combines visual elements with text to give context and alignment within content.

title: Pagination
description: Pagination breaks down large amounts of content across a series of pages.

title: Progress Indicator
description: Progress indicators show a user how far along they are in a process.

title: Results bar
description: Results bar indicate the number of results in a list and allow a user to sort by their preferred option.

title: Side navigation
description: Enables users to move through levels of site hierarchy.

title: Steps
description: Create a visual journey or link between sections of content.

title: Tables
description: Tables assist users to scan and compare data.

title: Tabs
description: Tabs allow users to switch between multiple sections or views.

title: Tags
description: Tags visually label or categorise content.

title: Search & Filters
description: Search allow users to explore products and services using keywords or phrases.

title: Maps
description: Maps allow you to show data relative to a physical location.

title: Data visualisation
description: Graphs and charts allow data to be comprehended quickly, allowing for faster analysis and conclusions

title: You are here
description: Help a user orientate themselves in your product or service.

title: Templates
description: Sample templates using the NSW Design System components and style to help you build pages.

title: Main navigation
description: Orientates a user and helps them move through the site.
